definition: (Tw) Clinton (name)/Bill Clinton (1946-), US Democratic politician, president 1993-2001/Hillary Rodham Clinton (1947-), US Democratic politician
woods/forest/CL:片[pian4]/circle(s) (i.e. specific group of people)/a collection (of similar things)
to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal

sentences.english: Clinton kicks off book tour with NY signing.
sentences.chinese: 柯林頓巡迴簽書會於紐約開跑。

sentences.english: Senator Clinton requested the investigation yesterday in a letter to the Army Inspector General.
sentences.chinese: 參議員要求調查柯林頓昨天在寫給陸軍監察長。

sentences.english: You can have dinner with former US President Bill Clinton by bidding online.
sentences.chinese: 只要上網競標，就能跟美國前總統柯林頓共進晚餐。

sentences.english: Mrs Clinton pushes carrot sticks towards him as he sits down.
sentences.chinese: 柯林頓太太把蘿菠條推到他面前。

sentences.english: As a casanova, he has many girl friends.
sentences.chinese: 許多人認爲柯林頓先生喜歡在女人窩裏。

sentences.english: Many people think that Mr. Clintonis a real lady's man.
sentences.chinese: 許多人認爲柯林頓先生喜歡在女人窩裏。

sentences.english: The Clinton administration's nuclear policy, therefore, has emphasized both diplomatic and defensive efforts to reduce unclear threats.
sentences.chinese: 因此，柯林頓政府的核武政策即強調外交與防衛並重。

definition: governor (of a province or colony)/US state governor/premier (Australian states)
Clinton (name)/Bill Clinton (1946-), US Democratic politician, President 1993-2001/Hillary Rodham Clinton (1947-), US Democratic politician
Taiwanese variant of 奧巴馬|奥巴马[Ao4 ba1 ma3], Barack Obama (1961-), US Democrat politician, president 2009-2017
Michel or Mitchell (name)/George Mitchell (1933-), US Democratic party politician and diplomat, influential in brokering Northern Ireland peace deal in 1990s, US Middle East special envoy from 2009

to swear the oath of office
variant of 邱吉爾|邱吉尔[Qiu1 ji2 er3]
